name: Oban Bay Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel,great views from lounge,we arrived very late due to extreme bad weather,9 hours on train,the restaurant was closed at 8-45pm,the bar had a lounge bar menu until 9pm,we asked to order some food,but were told the restaurant was closed!!!but we said we wanted to order from the 'Lounge Menu',we were told we could not,so,they have a 'Lounge Menu' but you can't order anything from it,as we had had a long journey,we were tired and hungry,we did not have any food,not very good.On our last night a large party of noisy Canadians were in and we could not sleep,one even rang the phone in our room at 2am!!!!Is a long walk to the town,but it does have great views,if you get a room at the back of the hotel it is a long walk to the room,and is a bit like a maze.We intend to go back to Oban,but would choose a different hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel,no food in lounge bar!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: there are 2 suits with sea view, the best of the rest has court view. The staff is friendly and help full, but everything considered you are better of in a B&B. It's a bit of a walk to town, but in the typically tropical weather of Oban, that's a treat. Lovely winter garden with unrivaled views.
reviews.title: Please read the small print and don't expect seaview

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends

We were then told to move our bikes from the single car space we occupied. More seriously an 8 pm restuarant closure , with roon sevice ending at the same time did not go down too well with the young French couple who were told the would have to go into town to eat .As a Scot I was ashamed at this poor example of service and so called scottish hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Oban Bay Hotel & Spa as part of a special offer from DADA, and I have to say it was excellent value. We booked DBB for 2 nights and the trip included bubbly on arrival, breakfast in bed and two spa treatments. The hotel staff were all so friendly, nothing was too much trouble (the only exception was the night-shift manager, who gave the impression he was the owner of the hotel. He strutted around clearing up glasses and candle holders and tried to put everyone off ordering more drinks). We had a nice room on the 3rd floor which had a view over the bay. Dinner is fine - people on the DBB package get the table d'hote menu but can order from a la carte for a charge. My only comment is that is would have been nice to have had our meals cooked to order but everything is pre-prepared for quick table turnaround. I would recommend eating later rather than earlier. On the first night we felt we were being served far more quickly than is decent. We ate at 19:30 on the second night and it was a much more relaxed experience. The luxury room service breakfast is excellent value - we got it as part of the package but it can be ordered for £29 per couple and includes an excellent breakfast choice of breakfasts, cereal, pastries and you even get a bottle of bubbly. We didn't need any lunch and we left the bubbly until we watched the Scotland rugby match later on in the day. Only quibble over the weekend would be that we were in our room all morning on the first full day and therefore missed having our room cleaned. The spa treatments are excellent - my husband and I had an back, neck & shoulder massage and it was wonderful and the lady who does these (a New Zealander) was lovely. We also enjoyed the steamroom, sauna and outdoor hot tub (even though it was rather bracing outside) - lovely once you get in it. I would recommend this for a relaxing break. The hotel management have the right idea in offering good package deals to get people in the door - other hotels in the area looked deserted but this hotel was pretty full. Very commendable in these difficult times.
reviews.title: Excellent value, friendly staff, overall excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple

I would have probably been quicker going into the town. As for the advertised breakfast buffet well that was yet another lie. . Overall you pay 4 star prices to get 1 star service. Would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

reviews.title: Ayrshire Macs First Visit

likes.disliked: — Dogs staying in hotel and Limited choice for vegetarians

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just returned from a one night spa break to this hotel. We had booked it sometime in advance and as the date approached we mailed the hotel and asked for an upgraded room. This cost and extra £25 and i think was worth it. We were allocated room 7, which although wasn't a huge room was very nice, with views to the front over the bay. I have seen some reviews saying the rooms were cold, however we put on our heater and found it cosy. Champange and chocs were delivered to the room, and we cannot fault the staff at all who were all fantastic friendly and helpful. We had booked the gold spa experience, and both has hour long sessions in the treatment room, which was bliss..!!! the therapist was fantastic and the massage and facial was just perfect. Also the spa area had a very steamy steam room, and sauna. the spa area itself is very nice, with seating areas and showers. The hot tub was a abit chilly as it was raining but would imagine it would be nice in better weather. The evening meal was also included and although we felt it was all served a little fast, it was good food and well prepared. Breakfast was table service from the menu and had a wide choice of food, hot and cold etc etc really good compared to some buffet style hotels I have been to. We enjoyed our stay and would return here. The only down I can think of was that the walls in our bathroom could have done with a good clean down as there were some weird stains on there but that would really be looking for fault.
reviews.title: Serene Spa...!

likes.liked: — The spa and the great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed on the 10th November at the Oban Bay Hotel in Oban. By booking directly with the hotel we were able to get a very favourable DB&B rate and on requesting a "sea-view", I was offered a suite at £40 extra for the night which I accepted.
reviews.title: Not Worth the Difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite, The Lismor, was in the front of the hotel and exactly as requested ...but it was FREEZING COLD. Both 2Kw heaters in the room were set on full power and working, but it still took 4 hours for the room to reach a suitable temperature, such that we could remove our sweaters ...yes, they were necessary!! Meantime, the bathroom NEVER became properly useable at all, due to the cold. Its only heating was a heated towel rail, which was totally inadequate for a large ceiling Victorian bathroom. The metal roll-top bath was so cold, that it had to be filled twice, once to warm up the bath, and then to take a bath in lukewarm water!!! Arguably the bathroom should be the warmest part of the suite. On going down to dinner, I asked the receptionist for some help in this matter, and she suggested that she would give me an electric fan heater to heat the bathroom (Health & Safety????), however, I accepted this offer as the only possibility, and, at about 10:15 p.m. it was delivered by the night porter, with an extension cable. Needless to say, it was used to warm up the bathroom a bit, then had to be removed each time, before the room could be used.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay
The Oban Experience
reviews.text: By the morning of the 11th, as we were leaving, the bedroom had heated up to a useable comfort level, but the bathroom, was still extremely cold. In hindsight, we would have been better to take a standard room, with less view and possibly better heating ....not £40 well spent, I suggest. The weather was very windy and cold but this cannot be an excuse as this is OBAN, and we are regular visitors!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We already knew about the lack of parking - but there is plenty of free parking just up the street so this really isn't a problem unless you are disabled. The hotel is just outside of the town centre which we liked as it was quiet, but as Oban is such a small place, it isn't a long walk to the centre.
reviews.title: Very friendly and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel consists of a lovely original building with a large carbuncle of an extension on the back where most of the rooms are and which have no view. Our room looked nice, but it had been done up on the cheap and everything felt as though it was about to come apart. One of the window latches didn't work and the shower was particularly feeble. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: An excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a lovely outlook onto Oban Bay, particularly on a sunny evening. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the service was efficient. The room and public areas were clean. There is limited parking, so it is wise to book. The choice on the table d'hote menu was limited, particularly for vegetarians, but the food itself was good - well conceived and well prepared (but vegetarian dish was weak).
reviews.title: Beautiful view and fantastic food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are things that are not perfect (poor hot water pressure, some decore needs refurbishment), but since they are not charging 5 star prices that is not critical.
reviews.title: Could be much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a very good stay.
reviews.title: Great food, let down by room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights DBB booked thru easy breaks and paid extra for a sea view room (room 24). It had a fantastic view down the sound of Kerrera and we could watch all the comings and goings at the harbour. The dining room is at the back of the hotel which is disappointing that it doesn't make the most of the view but the bar/conservatory is at the front. Both breakfast and especially dinner were exceptionally good and got clean plates every night! Watch out for John, the laconic Lithuanian waiter - he reminded me of Chic Murray!
reviews.title: Lovely stay in Oban!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: When we arrived told the lift was round the corner.when we got round the corner we came across a long walk and stairs.I had a large suitcase and my elderly mother with a walking frame.We were never offered any help and experienced a struggle.which we struggled every time we went up or down to our room.Several other guests commented on this to us in passing.However our room was comfortable,the food was lovely.The staff were also very friendly
reviews.title: loved most of it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: These Crerar hotels have totally restored my faith in 3 star hotels. Compared to some three star hotels - well there is no comparison. Bit embarrassed to admit that I uttered the phrase, "I don't do three star,"(cringe!!!) following a few revolting experiences of three star British hotels. I guess that's the gamble with the good old VS star rating system.
reviews.title: Little Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really friendly staff, delicious food on set menu deal with a surprise and welcome sorbet course. Stunning views from the hot tub and relaxed, friendly atmosphere. Came for the first time in Nov 2010 and was glad to come back this year. Great time had and only couple of mins stroll into Oban town centre. Gorgeous views from the front lounge over the sea and out to the islands..
reviews.title: stayed june 05/06 for 2 nights may be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: just back from a few days break at this hotel we stayed in room 136..the food was great and the staff the best i have seen in along time helpful and friendly we were there on a walking break .breakfast dinner and a pack lunch great value.on the downside room small no veiws as this was an extrra £25a night A bit steep? the window did not close properly and had a lot of condensation in the morning and was in need of replacement .the toilet seat was loose as was the glass shelf ,stained shower curtain and a shower mat that was once white very grubby around bath handles,and the noise when someone flushed their toilet was loud for about 30 seconds not long but through the night? if you wonder did i complain well if the housekeeper could not see this it shows you the standard. could not park car at hotel and parked it 200 yds away not a problem for me but could be for others at the bar it cost me £3.30 for a can of iron bru and a small bottle of ginger ale this is not a macdonalds or hilton hotels
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having taken a 'special deal' we weren't expecting much of this hotel. However we were in the newer block of this hotel and the room was very good with a well appointed bathroom. We had booked dinner for 8-00 and the service was so quick we could have been out of the dinning room by 8-30 if we hadn't asked to be given a break after our main course. This hotel caters for bus parties and the kitchen is amasingly good at catering for a large number of people arriving at the same time. The menu was limited but what we had was very well prepared and very good. The hotel offered Spa facilites but this turned out to be a sauna and a steam room. Both were not hot enough to be useful for the intended purpose. There was a outdoor hot tub but there was a mother and her three children in it at 10 o'clock at night so we didn't use it. Breakfast was very good. Porridge excellent and scrambled eggs and bacon very good. Parking spaces had to be booked and paid for before arrival. We were not told about this when we booked and there were no spaces available. There were only 6 or 7 anyway. Nearest parking was on the road but over 300 yards from the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent service and wonderful spa

description: Enjoying a prime position on the seafront, the Oban Bay Hotel & Spa has great views to Mull and Kerrera. For guests looking to relax and get away from it all, the hotel now offers an outdoor hot tub, spa treatments, along with a small sauna and steam room. In addition, Oban Bay Hotel has a comfortable bar and lounge area from which you can watch the world go by.
